timeline.subject: George de Hault
timeline.details: Prévôt of St. Dié goes to Saint Lienard to take informations following general rumour

timeline.subject: George de Hault
timeline.details: Initial interrogation, admitted quarrels but denied threats and harm

timeline.subject: George de Hault
timeline.details: No result; did not reproach witnesses, admitted disputes

timeline.subject: George de Hault
timeline.details: Remy as procureur général requests question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: George de Hault
timeline.details: Torture session beginning 7am, resumed 2pm; confessed to witchcraft, seduction of sister-in-law, malefices

timeline.subject: George de Hault
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves death sentence

timeline.subject: George de Hault
timeline.details: Execution carried out; final statement denied knowing accomplices, confessed thefts

accomplices_named.name: George Jobert's wife of St. Margaree

prior_accusations.context: Charged George with killing two oxen and being a witch; taken to St. Dié around 4 years before trial

notable_quotes.speaker: George de Hault
notable_quotes.french: Monsieur le maire je suis homme de bien quoyque l'on dise mais jamais je ne vous feray plus de mal ny aux votres et veult demeurer votre amy.
notable_quotes.english: Sir mayor, I am a good man whatever people say, but I will never do you or yours any more harm and wish to remain your friend.
notable_quotes.context: George's response when Demenge Valencin threatened to have valet kill him with axe

notable_quotes.speaker: George de Hault
notable_quotes.french: qu'il n'en mourait pas et qu'il le falloit encor laisser un peu
notable_quotes.english: that he would not die from it and must be left a little longer
notable_quotes.context: George's reply when told the maire intended to have him arrested unless he healed him

notable_quotes.speaker: Demenge Valencin
notable_quotes.french: si on vouloit bien faire il le fauldroit brusler et que de luy il n'en s'en mesloit volontier de ses affaires par ce qu'auparavant il s'en avoit desja mal trouvé
notable_quotes.english: if one wanted to do right he should be burned, and as for him he willingly didn't meddle in his affairs because previously he had already come off badly
notable_quotes.context: Demenge Valencin's response to George's mother-in-law asking him to take action

notable_quotes.speaker: George de Hault to Jean Pierat
notable_quotes.french: qu'il falloit qu'il le tuast ou bien qu'il le fut
notable_quotes.english: that he must kill him or be killed by him
notable_quotes.context: Threat made before maire of ban de Saulcy during dispute

notable_quotes.speaker: George de Hault
notable_quotes.french: qu'il avoit ja faict saulter un sien autre frere, et qu'il luy feroit encor saulter un aultre sault
notable_quotes.english: that he had already made one of his brothers jump, and would make him take another jump
notable_quotes.context: Threat to Claudon Pierat about making him 'jump' like his brother

notable_quotes.speaker: Marguitte femme a Jean Mauguin
notable_quotes.english: bad habit of speaking this way
notable_quotes.context: George's explanation for his threatening language, claiming misfortunes came from other witches

economic_context.details: George lost position as guard of menu bestail when Jean Mansuy offered lower rate. Multiple debt disputes including 3 resaulx of oats sold for 14 francs with 6 month payment delay leading to court. Dispute over taille collection - Nicolas Jeannel paid 4 francs for George. Multiple disputes over tithe collection positions. Wood theft mentioned. Grain measuring disputes when George was dismeur. Property boundaries and grazing disputes.

prior_legal_disputes.description: Demenge Pierel called George witch and had him arrested and taken to St. Dié approximately 4 years before; George claims he obtained reparation before Jean de Scarux, then doyen de prévôt
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: unclear outcome; witness lent Pierel money for costs but didn't know if found in wrong

Sold oats to Colas Collenat for 14 francs, payment delayed 6 months
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: went to court, only received 12 francs

prior_legal_disputes.description: Dispute with Jean Pierat went to justice before maire of ban de Saulcy

prior_legal_disputes.outcome: George made reparation to Jean Demenge Valentin, but latter made none for calling him witch

prior_legal_disputes.description: Found stealing wood, threatened with axe
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: fell to knees begging mercy, promised not to do it again

legal_context.redress_outcome: Multiple witnesses stated George had been called witch publicly but never sought reparation; George claimed he lacked the means to do so
legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: George imprisoned in house of Jean Demenge Valentin when arrested by Demenge Pierel

Discussion about sister accusing George of causing illness

Saw Marchant's strange illness in 1588, Marchant told of suspicions against George

extraction_metadata.notes: Trial record is exceptionally detailed with 35 witnesses. George confessed under torture to witchcraft after initially denying. Notable marginal note by Remy or clerk stating torture should not be renewed after such an interval (between 7am and 2pm sessions). George confessed to affair with sister-in-law lasting 7-8 years, which judges suggested led to witchcraft. Refused to name accomplices despite severe questioning, saying he did not want to damn himself. Only named two already-executed women seen at masked sabbat. At execution still denied knowing accomplices but confessed to various thefts. Economic status assessed as 'poor' based on: lost job to lower bidder, multiple debts, stated he lacked means to seek legal reparation, confession to stealing hay, grain, fish, and planks. Practiced healing: false - no evidence of healing practice. Language region: French based on location in Lorraine and French testimony quotes. Reputation duration ranges from 6-20+ years across witnesses.
